intro: Hebecladus asperus, commonly known as the rough hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces spikes of blue or purple flowers, which bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is often cultivated in gardens throughout the Southern Hemisphere.
